Topic.Title: Wonder what the BOD was thinking in not hiring Levinsohn, who was doing a great job, was....

Message.Msg: you got that right on business culture and practice in Asia, which is why Bartz had to leave. They pretty much rehired Bartz but add to that java programming skills.. woopie doo... I mean, this has to be a joke of a hiring. Now you have news of execs leaving yahoo left and right.. internally, no one respects Marissa because they all know she is going on vacation pretty soon. And Marissa is also a fool for taking up this no-win job. You have millions already, why take up a job that calls for you to work 100 hrs a week when you have a baby due? look out for your family first, take your multi-million from google accumulated and be with your kid full time. Why take up a job that you know you can't commit too without sacrificing family.... that is why the market have no confidence with Marissa now, they know she can't put in the hours and be with her baby soon. Yahoo BOD and Loeb made a big mistake. Now they need a co-CEO, framed as COO to do the real job.

Topic.Title: Yahoo in the midst of selling its stake in Yahoo! Japan back to Softbank

Message.Msg: How can Yahoo sell something back to Softbank that Softbank never owned? How is getting $3 billion in cash and $1.5 billion in assets for a share that has a market value of $7 billion good?

Message.Title: Blah Blah Blah BOD Blah Blah Wah Wah BOD

Topic.Title: Yahoo in the midst of selling its stake in Yahoo! Japan back to Softbank

Message.Msg: Other than Eric Jackson (whom has little credibility left) where does the $4.5 bil ($3 bil cash) figure for Y-Jap come from? If the market cap is over $7 bil why can't they sell it for close to that? My understanding is Y-Jap is doing pretty well so if Softbank won't pay a fair price why can't they sell sell it for $7 bil to some other entity or on the market (to funds, perhaps a bit at a time on open market, to PE etc.) and pay the taxes and still end up with $5 bil or so cash (they won't have to pay 35% one entire $7 bil as they put some investment into Y-Jap)? Or in cash/rich split take any reasonable asset (approx $2.5 bil) that can be sold later, and $4.5 bil in cash. Why is everything so hard for YHOO and takes so long??

Message.Title: YHOO's failure still comes down to that sleazy idiot Jerry Yang. After screwing....
Message.Msg: ...shareholders with the MSFT turn down, and then hiring the debacle that was Bartz, and having Ma steal Alipay, he hires Thompson and leaves with his tail between his legs. As the founder and owner who caused so much harm for shareholders, he had a DUTY to get YHOO-with all its clearly valuable assets-sold in a fair way (not the PIPE where he wanted to steal from shareholders again) for the best price. In the fall of 2011 after Bartz left, he should have been able to easily sell YHOO for $22 to $24, but chose to play games with strategic review and pay lots of money to GS to screw shareholders, and say YHOO was NOT for sale, and then leave us in the hands of the terrible BOD and Thompson, (who solicited the job).

Message.Title: Rats Fleeing the Ship.
Message.Msg: Never a good sign when the rats start leaving a ship. They know bad things are happening. Can't wait for this thing to hit $8. Eric Jackson's blog yesterday sounded like something written by a man who has lost a good part of his mind. I can't wait for him to really flip out as Yahoo continues to crash upon the rocks. Dan Loeb's street credentials are also being lost as he continues to pull on the Yahoo starter. There is plenty of fuel Dan, but it is all leaking into the bilge. The waves are getting taller and the Seas are getting rougher, but the bow has been staved in. She's taking on water and the tiller is floating leagues behind her. All she needs is one rouge wave and Davy Jones can open his locker and welcome to their final home Yahoo investors.

Message.Title: Marissa Mayer - Very unprofessional & unethical because
Message.Msg: I feel the new CEO Marissa Mayer is very unprofessional & unethical because she openly has started pulling Google employees to come work for Yahoo. Given she worked there just a month ago and that both companies compete directly isn't this consider wrong? All Google employees coming knows exactly what Google did, is doing or will be doing going forward. I can understand if MM attracts talent from other places due to her contacts but inviting Google folks sounds too unethical and unprofessional to me. Also she is totally inexperienced to be CEO as she has never ever been one in her life. If Carl Icahn and others can't make this stock rise in last 5 yrs despite several seasoned CEO's like Carol Bartz, Terry Semel, etc I don't know how much Marissa Mayer would be able to do given her lack of finance & business operations knowledge imho. Do you guys agree?

Topic.Title: Marissa Mayer - Very unprofessional & unethical because

Message.Msg: Agree and feel the only answer is for YHOO to be sold ASAP. It seems that under MM YHOOO is back to keeping shareholders in the dark and taking forever to get anything done. And the stock has dropped in a strong market! Look at how much Levinsohn got done (AG deal, FB settlement-though honestly not sure that was so good unless YHOO is just sold soon) in his short tenure. YHOO just needs to be sold and Levinsohn would have been best to get that done. I see no evidence that MM is anything but a gamble and time killer. YHOO just needs to be sold!

Message.Title: But why has the market had such a harsh assesment of MM? I want her to succeed but....
Message.Msg: ...just from a basic health stand point, sleep is very imortant, and stress is very bad, even if you are not pregnant. How can taking this job possibly be good for the baby's well being? Yes in India poor women have a baby and are back working in the fields the next day. But not running at multi bil. $co. I just don't see how MM can be a wise pick for YHOO but the mistake has been made, and the share price seems to show that. The market has been very strong and YHOO very weak. What happens when the market goes down? Well some protection since YHOO is already on the floor compared to its tangable assets.

Message.Title: mm's keeping price up to let big boys out
Message.Msg: that's why the volume was up......big crash coming jmho

Topic.Title: mm's keeping price up to let big boys out

Message.Msg: that is pretty funny....mm's 'keeping the price up' . It may not have dropped today but it sure is not up. IMO it is way under priced because they have not yet monetized the Asian assets, folks are reacting to not getting a quick fix of cash, and few folks really care about the company. It would appear to me that the market is at best indifferent to Yahoo! if not outright hostile. Some have good reason to be upset and tired of waiting but it appears as if most have simply given up and want to see a liquidation sale. Personally, I would like to see some real action - either sell the company or have it do something constructive and grow at a rapid pace.....right now it seems to be doing nothing........and the share price is going nowhere....and so it will be until Yahoo is decisive one way or the other [I don't care which]

Topic.Title: mm's keeping price up to let big boys out

Message.Msg: I agree with you about the price. However I think there is very little that mm can do with Yahoo as it is today. I read that still another of their top sales people is leaving. I'm guessing that anybody reasonably creative with a good resume already has it on the street. The new board members, even with their great CV's, haven't a clue because they have no communication within the company. The corporate culture is lying up the food chain and CYA. Previously issued stock options have little, if any value. Yahoo is just too far gone; they don't have anything like the depth of talent that they need to turn it around; they can't hire that talent. I personally believe that the company needs to be broken up and sold. The users are worth something.

Message.Title: Just did a search to check on market cap of YHOO-Jap and clicked on some old...
Message.Msg: ...articles from last fall. Then it seemed that a sale of Y-Jap was imminent (put value of YHOO stake then at $7 to 8 bil.) and a sale of the over all company seemed so certain soon and for a price well above where we are now. I think Ma and Yang worked to destroy a sale. Also the value of all AG was put at $32 bil (per Silverlake DST buy) and yet all YHOO got in recent $7.1 bil deal was at the equiv. price of $35 for all AG., (with some upside if it goes for more than $35 bil) It must actually be worth much more than that now. What $50 bil??? And yet NOTHING has happened and YHOO is still on the mat. Something has to be done! SOON MM!!!

Message.Title: ceo or pregnant mother
Message.Msg: i think this topic was disgusting! LIVE WITH IT-she is pregnant & will continue to be the ceo (like it or not). we can have fun with it but telling her she has two choices (get rid of the baby or resign) is totally STUPID ! what if YOUR WIFE was pregnant & they told her if she didn't have the abortion they wouldn't promote her? i hope the one that wrote the message is up for a raise (or promotion) & his employer notifies him to remove his thing or take a hike! don't blame her for taking the job since it was a brilliant move on her part! (she got the job & loads of money plus benefits & being pregnant at the same time) lets realize where the blame is & that's yahoos board /especially mr. loeb that was always worshipped on this messenger board! remember he got his friends put on the board to make the right decisions.

Message.Title: Coldone says to buy!!
Message.Msg: I am Coldone - the man, the myth, the legend. I say buy low and sell high. Or is it buy high, sell low? It's confusing at times, but I'm always right. Follow me, and never lose money except for when you do. I have many sources, reliable voices in my head, that tell me when is a good time to buy. Chances are, if you buy when I tell you to, and you hold it long enough and sell at the right time, you may make a profit or not. Either way, I am Coldone and rule all!
